biotools.summary: The South Green Genome Hub is a suite of crop-specific community portals to manage genomic datasets with focus on tropical and Mediterranean plants. Currently developed on Banana, Cacao, Coffee, Grass, Rice, Vanilla, Citrus and Sugarcane, genome hubs provide access to multiple datasets (e.g. assemblies, gene product information, metabolic pathways, gene families, transcriptomics and genetic markers).

bioschemas.name: South Green Genome Hubs
